name: Hard NFL and Major League Baseball Quiz / Test | USA | 5 Questions

questions.text: What year did the San Diego Padres join Major League Baseball?
questions.explanation:
1969.

	Before the Padres joined the majors, they were a triple A team. The Montreal Expos also joined that year.

questions.text: In which city did the Arizona Cardinals first play when they joined the NFL?
questions.explanation:
Chicago.

	The Cardinals played in this city from 1920-1959. They played in St. Louis from 1960-87, before moving to Phoenix in 1988.

questions.text: For which team did Babe Ruth become an assistant manager after he left the Yankees?
questions.explanation:
Boston Braves & Boston & Braves.

	It was his dream to become a manager, but he never had the honor.

questions.text: How many homeruns did Hank Aaron hit in his career?
questions.explanation:
755.

	Hank was very consistent in his career.  He hit 44 home runs 4 times in a season, and had a season high of 47.

questions.text: What player had played in the most consecutive games with the New York Yankees?
questions.explanation:
Lou Gehrig.

	He played in 2,130 consecutive games from 1925 to 1939.
